contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Tōyo'''|東予市|Tōyo-shi}} was a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Ehime prefecture|Ehime]], [[Japan]]. On November 1, 2004 Tōyo, along with the towns of [[Komatsu, Ehime|Komatsu]] and [[Tanbara, Ehime|Tanbara]], both from [[Shūsō District, Ehime|Shūsō District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Saijō, Ehime|Saijō]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 32,652 and the [[population density|density]] of 441.90 persons per km². The total area was 73.89 km². The city was founded on October 1, 1972. {{DEFAULTSORT:Toyo, Ehime}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ehime Prefecture]] {{Ehime-geo-stub}}
